g.H3588: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
g.H4805: bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) rebellion; concretely, bitter, or rebellious
g.H1004: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

g.H1696: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
g.H854: properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
g.H6605: to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

g.H413: near, with or among; often in general, to
g.H3541: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
g.H136: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
g.H8085: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
g.H2308: properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
